intro: Levenhookia murfetii, commonly known as the Murfet's leavenhook, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its small, daisy-like yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is often found in coastal areas. It has narrow, linear leaves and produces a compact, bushy growth habit. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
